profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:13-0400

did.unittitle: Society for the Propagation of the Gospel in Foreign Parts (Great Britain) records, 1701-1786
did.abstract: These records represent volumes 21-22 of the Society's archive of documents relating to North America, and includes letters to and from Pennsylvanians, or the missionaries sent there, and a few from New York, and from Massachusetts.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Society for the Propagation of the Gospel in Foreign Parts (Great Britain)

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This is a microfilm of an early American collection that may be of interest to researchers at the APS and may complement an original manuscript collection at the APS.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Microfilm, Ltd. ($45.00) and accessioned, 1984 (1984 19mf).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Those wishing to quote from, reproduce or publish these materials should write to The Archivist, Society for the Propagation of the Gospel in Foreign Parts, London, England.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: There is an introduction to the records at the beginning of the film.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Society was founded in 1701 to provide orthodox clergy to the British colonies.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in Society for the Propagation of the Gospel in Foreign Parts (Great Britain).
